medical_history.chief_complaint: The patient presents with refractory epilepsy characterized by generalized seizures, nodding attacks, and dropping attacks.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's symptoms began at 8 years of age with a generalized seizure attack. He occasionally experienced visual auras, including bright or colorful flashing lights and blurry vision, primarily before seizures. At 17 years of age, he had transient nodding attacks, often without an aura. Dropping attacks began at 18 years, occurring 2–10 times in 4–5 days, typically accompanied by gripped hands and slight forearm flexion, and without aura or memory of the events afterward.
